intro: Pityrodia lewellinii, commonly known as the Christmas tree bush, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in winter. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive appearance. Pityrodia lewellinii prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade.
